* This is my first time working with part clipping and SSTO's, so be gentle *

This is a small family of easy to fly, heavily part clipped and sleek looking SSTO's designed for beginners and experts alike. They are ideal as trainer SSTO's, due to exceptional handling and large margin for error. Experts will also enjoy their sport-like designs and maneuverability, while also taking advantage of decent range and abilities of these craft.

The Idon Series is composed of 3 models: Model A, Model B and the Model C. Each Model also has two subcategories, being Citizen and Utility. However, the Model C has three subcategories, the third one being Crew Bus. So far, the Model A is the only model in production.

You have been warned: These crafts contain very heavy part clipping and are made for fun and enjoyment, not realism. In saying that, you could ration that these are highly advanced spaceplanes built on metallic hydrogen rocket engines and triple-mode jet, ramjet and scramjet air-breathing engines. Anyways, have fun!

Idon Model A

The Model A is the cheapest and smallest of the Idon Series, featuring an agile and sleek exterior. They are built upon the Mk1 Cockpit, so only one Kerbal can be carried at any one time.

*

Model A Utility and the Model B Citizen will be uploaded tomorrow! Preview of features:

- Model A Utility can dock, refuel and fly to the Mun.

- Model B Citizen can land on the Mun, refuel and fly back to Kerbin.

*

Model A Citizen

Designed for the average (Albeit wealthy) Kerbal, this spaceplane is the perfect beginner SSTO for all those thrill seekers out there! It flies with ease, and is capable of flying into a 150x150 orbit and back to the space center with fuel to spare. Flight profile is easy: Just use the turbojet to reach near orbital speeds (1800-2000m/s), then switch over to the rocket drive to circularize and maneuver in space!

Cost: $33,658

Action Groups:

[1] Turbojet

[2] Rocket Mode
